title: GREY DAWN
text: Day. A crowd is gathered under this banner and listens to Father Maxi as he delivers a service.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Friends, we gather in this place to mourn the victims of yesterday's tragedy: nine good people who were run over in the street by an elderly woman driver.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh God, memorial services are sooo boring.

title: GREY DAWN
text: You insensitive asshole, Cartman! Nine people died!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah, but like, eight of them were hippies. Mostly hippies go to farmer's markets. Mostly

title: GREY DAWN
text: It is sometimes hard, in times like these, to understand God's way. Why would he allow nine innocent people to be run down in the prime of their lives by a senior citizen who, perhaps, shouldn't be driving? It is then that we must understand, God's sense of humor is very different from our own. He does not laugh at the simple "man walks into a bar" joke. No, God needs complex irony and subtle farcical twists that seem macabre to you and me. All that we can hope for is that God got his good laugh and a tragedy such as this will never happen again.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Look out!!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Huh? Was that a stop sign back there? Ooooh, I think I hit a pot hole.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Stan's house, night. The family is eating dinner - tacos, nachos, rice, milk

title: GREY DAWN
text: Hey Dad, how come they let old people drive?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Well, Stan, it's a very fragile issue.

title: GREY DAWN
text: But they kill people.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Sometimes, yes, but senior citizens have to be dealt with very gingerly, Stan. We can't just take their licenses away.

title: GREY DAWN
text: I'll be God-damned if they think they can take my license away!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oooh, hi Dad.

title: GREY DAWN
text: I heard what you said! You wanna take drivin' privileges away from seniors! Well let me tell you something, peckerface! I worked fifty five years in the steel mill!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yes Dad.

title: GREY DAWN
text: And I flew Spitfires over Germany in World War II!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yes I know.

title: GREY DAWN
text: And I will be God-damned if the government thinks it can step in and take away my right to drive!

title: GREY DAWN
text: I think old people should have rights, Grandpa. I just don't wanna die.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Stark's Pond, night. A lone man is fishing in the middle of the pond. He senses something ominous and looks around. On the road nearby, a brown Buick drives by slowly. A short old woman is at the wheel

title: GREY DAWN
text: Damnit Mona, this isn't the fastest way to Country Kitchen Buffet!

title: GREY DAWN
text: No, but it's the shortest. I save the most gas that way.

title: GREY DAWN
text: You save the most gas if you take the highway to Country Kitchen Buffet!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Less miles means less gas, you old fool.

title: GREY DAWN
text: There's Country Kitchen right there!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Where?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Right there! You're gonna miss it!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Is this the parking lot?

title: GREY DAWN
text: I think so.

title: GREY DAWN
text: News 4. A splash screen shows various correspondents and anchors, and a globe spins in front of the montage

title: GREY DAWN
text: Another death tonight by a senior citizen motorist. Carl Zorn of Pine Junction was killed instantly when struck by a vehicle driven by Pete and Lydia Malman, who were trying to find Country Kitchen Buffet. This latest tragedy comes only two days after the accident in Deer Creek, where three construction workers and a bulldozer  were run down by senior citizen Paul Thom , who was trying to find Country Kitchen Buffet. Public outcry is forcing the DMV to consider suspending the licenses of all seniors over seventy, though no decision has yet to be made.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Park County Community Center, day. The seniors have gathered there for a meeting

title: GREY DAWN
text: Seniors of South Park, I don't know about you, but I am mad as hell!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah!

title: GREY DAWN
text: I'm sick of having my mental condition come into question!

title: GREY DAWN
text: We need to let everyone know we're pissed off, and we're not gonna take it anymore!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah! Yeah! That's right, Pete!

title: GREY DAWN
text: That's right! Now, ...can anybody remember what we're pissed off about?  Now, remember we're all pissed about something and uh... that's why we had this meeting, but I... can't for the life of me re-

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oooo. Was it the kids skateboarding on the sidewalks? No?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh, I remember! They're gonna take our licenses away!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah! Yeah! That's right!

title: GREY DAWN
text: That's right! They're gonna try and take our licenses away! And I, for one, am mad as hell!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Me too! Yeah, that's right! And mine too!

title: GREY DAWN
text: I'm sick of having my mental condition come into question!

title: GREY DAWN
text: So now, what are we gonna do about it?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Do about what?

title: GREY DAWN
text: They're gonna take our licenses away.

title: GREY DAWN
text: They are?? They can't do that!

title: GREY DAWN
text: That's right. So you know what I think we should do? I think we should have a senior citizens' meeting! Get all the senior together a the community center and unite!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Great idea, Marvin!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Wait, ah I think we're having that meeting right now.

title: GREY DAWN
text: ...Oh, right, this is the meeting.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Right. To get those damn kids to stop skateboarding on the sidewalks!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah! Yeah! That's right! Someone's gotta stop them!

title: GREY DAWN
text: The Marsh house, day. Sharon and Shelley are making construction paper cutouts in the kitchen. Shelley has finished some eyes

title: GREY DAWN
text: Sharon, have you seen Dad?

title: GREY DAWN
text: He's not here, hun. He's having a meeting with all the seniors in town at the community center.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh.  Wait a minute. If all the seniors in town are at a meeting, that means that when the meeting gets out...

title: GREY DAWN
text: Every senior in town will be driving home...

title: GREY DAWN
text: At the same time.  Oh My God!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Downtown South Park. People are milling around. Randy runs into the scene

title: GREY DAWN
text: Get inside! Get inside!  Seniors' meeting getting out! Get off the streets!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh my Goddd!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Park County Community Center, day. The seniors exit the center and head for their cars

title: GREY DAWN
text: All right, great meeting everyone. Let's do it again sometime.

title: GREY DAWN
text: So long, everybody.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Goodbye, Missy.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Downtown South Park, at the farmer's market. Randy runs in

title: GREY DAWN
text: Get off the streets! Get off the streets! Old people are driving!  Gerald! Where are the boys?!

title: GREY DAWN
text: We've gotta get out of here!

title: GREY DAWN
text: The boys, Gerald! Where are they?!

title: GREY DAWN
text: They, they're... they're playing street hockey!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh My God!!

title: GREY DAWN
text: The neighborhood. Stan and the boys are playing street hockey. Cartman is the goalie, a trashcan his goal

title: GREY DAWN
text: With just ten seconds to go, the offense makes its move. Marsh heads for the goal and paases the ball to the poor kid. The poor kid hands it out to the Jew! The Jew shoots. Awww, and the shot is blocked again , proving once and for all that Jews cannot play hockey!

title: GREY DAWN
text: It isn't fair. Cartman's fatter than the goal.

title: GREY DAWN
text: I'm not fat. I just have a sweet hockey body.

title: GREY DAWN
text: GET OFF THE STREETS!  GET OFF THE STREETS!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Dude, look!

title: GREY DAWN
text: GET OFF... THE STREETS! GET OFF THE STREETS!

title: GREY DAWN
text: What is that?

title: GREY DAWN
text: I don't know.

title: GREY DAWN
text: GET OFF... GET STRAIGHT OFF THE STREET!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Dude, is that your dad?

title: GREY DAWN
text: I think so.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Looks like Stan's dad's been hittin' the bottle again.

title: GREY DAWN
text: -STREETS!! OFF-

title: GREY DAWN
text: What is he saying?

title: GREY DAWN
text: I can't understand him.

title: GREY DAWN
text: GAAAAAH!!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Calm down! We cannot understand you!

title: GREY DAWN
text: (Ohhhhh, look!)  (You guys!)

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh Jesus!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Old people!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Come on!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh God, they're coming!

title: GREY DAWN
text: The Lodge. The group enters, Randy shuts and blocks the doors

title: GREY DAWN
text: Get over there! Stay low!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Why are they all out driving at the same time?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Shhhh!  It's okay, boys. They're gone. Let's just lay low for a minute until we can find-  AWWWW!!

title: GREY DAWN
text: I don't remember there being a building here.

title: GREY DAWN
text: RUN!

title: GREY DAWN
text: I told you to turn left, Larry.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Get up the stairs! Up the stairs! Come on! Come on!!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Aah! There's another one!

title: GREY DAWN
text: AAAHH!!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Excuse me, is this Costello Avenue?

title: GREY DAWN
text: In here!

title: GREY DAWN
text: They're not gonna stop until we're all dead!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Quiet! Keep quiet!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Dad, I'm scared.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Just, keep your voices down. We'll stay the night in here. We'll stay the whole winter if we have to.

title: GREY DAWN
text: I'm not staying the winter in this room! We just need to tell old people they can't drive anymore!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Awgh. Stan, it's not that simple! Just relax while I find the lights. Here we go.

title: GREY DAWN
text: How the hell did we get up here?

title: GREY DAWN
text: AAAAAAAHH!!

title: GREY DAWN
text: I told you this was the wrong way!

title: GREY DAWN
text: News 4. A splash screen shows various correspondents and anchors, and a globe spins in front of the montage

title: GREY DAWN
text: Tom, I'm standing outside of the Department of Motor Vehicles, where senior citizens have until three p.m. to hand over their driver's licenses. The new law was passed just three days after the Night of Horror, in which all seniors were out driving at the same time, causing fourteen deaths and three million dollars in damage.

title: GREY DAWN
text: DMV, inside. A poster on the wall says "Drive 65 MPH. Stay alive." Two men and a woman sit at a table taking the licenses seniors standing in line give them.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Alrighty.  There we go. Next?

title: GREY DAWN
text: It ain't right what you're doin'! I never had an accident in my life!

title: GREY DAWN
text: That's right. You shouldn't punish all of us.

title: GREY DAWN
text: We're sorry, but this is the only way to be sure. Next please.  There we go.

title: GREY DAWN
text: But how am I supposed to get to the grocery store? Or the pharmacy to buy medicine?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Well, maybe you should be in a nursing home. Hmmm?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Some of us would rather die!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Well, we can certainly help you with that, too.

title: GREY DAWN
text: We aren't second-class citizens!

title: GREY DAWN
text: That's right! You can take our licenses, but you'll never take our pride!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah...

title: GREY DAWN
text: Stan's house, day. The boys leave the house

title: GREY DAWN
text: Ooooh, isn't this great you guys? Being able to walk the streets now that old people are confined to their homes where they belong?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Billy, get in the car! I need you boys to help me pick up my new Hov-Around.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Uh, Grandpa, I don't think you should be driving.

title: GREY DAWN
text: God-damnit Billy! You're supposed to listen to your dad, right?! Well I'm your dad's dad, and that means you get in this car before I tan all your hides!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Well, look at it this way: statistically speaking, we're safer inside a car with an old person driving than outside.

title: GREY DAWN
text: My God, he's right.  Hail Mary, full of grace, the Lord is with thee, even though I walk through the valley of death.  Guys, I don't know if I ever told you this, but, well, I love you guys.  Except for you, Kyle.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Okay, all set?

title: GREY DAWN
text: (Oooooo my God!)

title: GREY DAWN
text: Ah, I think there's a police car behind you, Grandpa.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Eh?  Go around. Go around, you moron!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Blue Impala, pull your vehicle over!

title: GREY DAWN
text: I believe that's us... thank God.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Could I see your license, please?

title: GREY DAWN
text: I ain't got one! You peckers took it!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Well then, I have to take you to jail.

title: GREY DAWN
text: You just try taking me to jail, scrotum-head! You just try!

title: GREY DAWN
text: The police jail. Marvin sits behind bars with a cane.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Stupid son of a- God damnit!

title: GREY DAWN
text: I just got him right here, Mr. Marsh.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh brother. Well, good job, dad! Look at you now!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh God damnit, don't you lecture me you son of a bitch!

title: GREY DAWN
text: You just had to be so damn stubborn, didn't you?!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Now my son is gonna talk to me like I'm twelve.

title: GREY DAWN
text: We're not treating you like children, Dad. All right? Now I think you owe Mr. Police Officer an apology. Who needs to apologize, hm?  Who's the sorry-sorry?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Kiss my sagging ass!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Well fine. I was gonna bail you out, but maybe you can just sit here for a bit and think about what you did!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Well I won't be sitting here long! I've already called the AARP!

title: GREY DAWN
text: What's that?

title: GREY DAWN
text: The American Association of Retired Persons! The largest political group in the country! When seniors like me are bein' descriminated against, the AARP comes and sets it right!  And you're gonna be sorry when they get here!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Mr. Garrison's classroom, day. He's giving his class a history lesson

title: GREY DAWN
text: And so you see, children, Genghis Khan was a "Mongol," not to be confused with a "mongoloid" like the actor, Nicholas Cage. Okay now, who can tell me in what ...year ...the ...first ...film by a... mongoloid...  That's odd.  Those ROTC guys are way off course.

title: GREY DAWN
text: More old people!

title: GREY DAWN
text: The American Association of Retired Persons.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Stay in your seats, children. I'll be right back.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Set up a perimeter! Bring Bravo Team to Point Delta!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Bravo Team is go.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Move! Move! Move!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Let's go! Let's go!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Uh, can I help you folks find something? Oowww!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Old people gone mad!

title: GREY DAWN
text: U.S. Geological Service. Randy sits at his desk making notes when he hears the soft rustling of tarp on snow. He spins around in his chair to see more AARP paratroopers. He rises in disbelief. A gas canister flies through the window and unleashes its fumes. Randy starts coughing. The door flies open and some AARP paratroopers walk in wearing gas masks.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Contact.  Put your hands up, young man!

title: GREY DAWN
text: South Park Jail. Marvin is looking out his small cell window when the AARP enters the jail and approach the cell

title: GREY DAWN
text: Marvin Marsh?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yes?

title: GREY DAWN
text: I'm Bill Stewart, President of the AARP. Hu-we've come to help the seniors in this town fight back.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh, it's nice to meet ya, Bill.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Huh?? We came as fast as we could. We just had to stop by Country Kitchen Buffet first.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Shady Acres, a Retirement Community. The AARP has arrived there

title: GREY DAWN
text: It's the nursing home! Liberate our comrades!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Shady Acres, inside

title: GREY DAWN
text: There now, Mr. Johnson.  We can go to the cafeteroa amd get you some creamed corn and toast.  Can I help you?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Help this!  The revolution is on, brother! We're taking control of the town!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Well, alright, well it's about damn time!  Hey everyone, we're taking the town.

title: GREY DAWN
text: The televison room. More seniors there are watching TV

title: GREY DAWN
text: Seniors, we're taking the town over.

title: GREY DAWN
text: The revolution is on!

title: GREY DAWN
text: The revolution?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh, I'd better get my other sweater.

title: GREY DAWN
text: A convalescent room

title: GREY DAWN
text: Mrs. Wyland, seniors are taking over the town. Would you like a gun?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh, I suppose so.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Downtown South Park, day. One of the members brings Randy forward

title: GREY DAWN
text: What the hell is going on?!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Shut your piehole and get over there!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Randy, what is this?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Hey! You are now under the authority of the AARP!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Ha! There you go, Mr. Smartmouth! Look at you now!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Dad, what are you doing??

title: GREY DAWN
text: The AARP is gonna help us take this town until we get our licenses back!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah, and we're gonna ask for more money in Medi-Care, too!

title: GREY DAWN
text: That's right.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Have you all got Alzheimer's? The-they're not gonna listen to a bunch of whacked out senior citizens.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Heh??  We'll tell them if they don't give us our demands, we'll start killin' hostages!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Huh, right. They're gonna really believe that.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Isn't that a little extreme, Bill?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Heh??  No, we gotta be tough! Just like with those damned Japs!

title: GREY DAWN
text: This is insane, Dad! You all need to stop right now before morp people get hurt>

title: GREY DAWN
text: The time when you can tell me what to do is over, pucky-boy! We're in charge now!

title: GREY DAWN
text: South Park, day. The town is now an encampment, protected by barbed wire, sandbags, and metal shields. A woman with an IV unit stands behind some sandbags

title: GREY DAWN
text: All right, we've got control of the Mayor's office and the fire station.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Reinforcements have arrived from the nursing home in Conifer.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Good! Hell, us senior citizens could take over the entire country!

title: GREY DAWN
text: We've got company!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Attention seniors: lay down your weapons and turns yourselves over!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Mrs. Applegate, show 'em we mean business.

title: GREY DAWN
text: All right.

title: GREY DAWN
text: What do you want?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Heh??

title: GREY DAWN
text: We want our licenses back!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah!

title: GREY DAWN
text: That's right. And we want more money in Medi-Care!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah!

title: GREY DAWN
text: And we want those damned kids to stop skateboardin' on the sidewalk!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Nighttime, the drive-in. All adults who are not senior citizens have been gathered into an enclosure around the massive screen. Two seniors stand guard at the gates, other seniors keep the adults in line. The adults are cold. Some cough, some try to keep warm by burning tires inside empty gas drums. Randy is one of those warming his hands over a fire. He moans. The boys arrive, having not been arrested

title: GREY DAWN
text: Hey Dad.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Stan! Boys! You're safe!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Dad, why is everyone letting old people do this? Why doesn't somebody stop them?

title: GREY DAWN
text: They've tried to stop them, son, but... the seniors get up so early in the morning they... get everything done before everyone else is even awake!

title: GREY DAWN
text: They're saying something about taking over the entire country.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yes. And now seeing how early they get up, I don't see how anyone can stop them. Wait a minute. You boys! You get up almost as early as they do! You can fight them!

title: GREY DAWN
text: No. Come on, Dad. Can't you guys do it?

title: GREY DAWN
text: No, son. We... like to sleep in.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Two hostages come front and center!

title: GREY DAWN
text: They're coming!! Get out of here before they see you! Run to the hills and find a way to fight them! Go!!  Boys, avenger me! AVENGER ME!!

title: GREY DAWN
text: The woods. The boys have set up a little camp there for the night.

title: GREY DAWN
text: All right, check it out. Kenny did reconnaissance on the town. The old people have blockades here  and here . The old ladies are keeping watch in towers around the perimeter, and the leaders along with my grandpa are most likely in the Mayor's office.

title: GREY DAWN
text: So our only solution is to cut off their life force.

title: GREY DAWN
text: We can't fight them, Cartman.

title: GREY DAWN
text: No. But we can sneak into town and shut down their food supply.  Here.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Country Kitchen Buffet?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah. You take out Country Kitchen Buffet, and old people won't know what to do.

title: GREY DAWN
text: That's a retarded idea, Cartman!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Is it? Two years ago they closed the Country Kitchen Buffet in Steamboat Springs. And all the old people died of starvation in less than a week.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah, I remember hearing about that.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Ech, even if it could work, how would we go about shutting it down?

title: GREY DAWN
text: I think I have a plan, though we'll have to do it tonight.  We'll start by sneaking into town, cleverly disguised as black people.  At 5:45 Kenny and Kyle split off and set a diversion on the east end of town.  Meanwhile, Stan and I sneak into the Mayor's office and steal some of the explosives the old people have stashed. Nine o'clock: we rendezvous at the Country Kitchen Buffet, where we strap the explosives and the timer to Kyle's chest. We say our triple goodbye to Kyle, and them we send him inside.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Yeah!

title: GREY DAWN
text: All right!

title: GREY DAWN
text: (Woohoo!)

title: GREY DAWN
text: Aw yeah!

title: GREY DAWN
text: We did it!

title: GREY DAWN
text: ...Yeah, or we just go to Country Kitchen Buffet and lock it from the inside so the seniors can't get in.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Well, right, or we could always do that.

title: GREY DAWN
text: South Park, day. The old people have the run of the town, and they're bringing in heavier artillery

title: GREY DAWN
text: All right everyone, round up your ammunition and get ready to move! We're takin' this war further out!

title: GREY DAWN
text: All right!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Uh, I appreciate what the AARP is tryin' to do for us, but uh, all we want is our licenses back.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Huh??  Heck no! This is goin' too well.We're gonna take the whole country back. Wipe out everyone below the age of sixty five!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Wipe 'em out?? What are you? Senile?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Come on, everyone! It's time to plan for Phase 2!  What the heck?  Huh? What is this?! It's 6 a.m. C-Country Kitchen should be open!

title: GREY DAWN
text: It's not open? It has to be!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Try a window.

title: GREY DAWN
text: They're blocked from the inside.

title: GREY DAWN
text: No...  Let us in! Let us in!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Open the door! It's six a.m.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Open the Country Kitchen Buffet for us!

title: GREY DAWN
text: You have to let us in!

title: GREY DAWN
text: All right everyone, area secure. Collect their weapons and free the hostages. That was a great strategy, boys. You may very well have saved this entire country.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Whoa-ho-ho-ooh, what happened? Is it over?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Everything is fine. Control of the town is back to you folks.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Country Kitchen... wha-what happened?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Sir, what should we do with this one?

title: GREY DAWN
text: It's up to the townspeople.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Well, I think he learned his lesson. Huh? Don't you feel silly now, Dad? I think somebody owes us all an apology. Yes he does.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Oh, stop it, Dad! This is partly your fault!

title: GREY DAWN
text: Huh?

title: GREY DAWN
text: Look, all Grandpa wants is not to be talked to like a child. I think half of what he was angry about wasn't what you were doing, but how you were doing it.

title: GREY DAWN
text: That's right.

title: GREY DAWN
text: And Grandpa, you should be proud that you made it through life to be a senior, but you should also realize that, when you're behind the wheel, you're a killing machine.

title: GREY DAWN
text: I know. I guess sometimes us seniors need to know when to stop driving so we don't put the responsibility on our families.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Well, I think this has been a real learning experience for the Marsh family. People died, but we all grew a bit. Let's just go home.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Sure. I'll drive.

title: GREY DAWN
text: That's our Grandpa.

title: GREY DAWN
text: Dude, I hate my family.
